title: Rotating subtle glowing border on the LoginPage primary button

requirements.summary: Add a subtle rotating glowing border animation to only the specified LoginPage button without affecting layout, behavior, or other buttons, including reduced-motion and disabled handling.
acceptanceCriteria: The selected button displays a subtle glowing border effect with a visibly rotating highlight moving around the perimeter.
The effect does not change the buttonâ€™s dimensions or cause layout shift (no jittering or reflow).
The effect is visible in both light and dark themes and remains subtle (not overpowering surrounding UI).
Hover/active/disabled states continue to work; when disabled, the glow is either removed or significantly subdued so the disabled state is still clear.
If the user has reduced-motion enabled (prefers-reduced-motion), the border animation is disabled (static border/glow is acceptable).
The change is applied only to the selected button, not globally to all buttons.

file_operations.description: Apply a dedicated, single-use className (e.g., "live-glow-border") to the existing Shadcn Button used for Sign In, ensuring it targets only this button and does not alter existing sizing/layout/click behavior.

Implement the rotating subtle glow border styles scoped to the new button class using pseudo-elements (absolute-positioned, pointer-events:none, border-radius:inherit) and a conic-gradient highlight with a rotation animation; include a prefers-reduced-motion media query to disable animation (static glow allowed) and disabled-state styles to remove/subdue the glow so disabled remains clearly disabled, while keeping the effect subtle in both light and dark themes.
